#Text=Zimbabwean opposition leader rejects calls for power sharing talks
#Text=Wednesday , July 2 , 2008

#Text=Morgan Tsvangirai , leader of the Zimbabwean opposition party Movement for Democratic Change ( MDC ) , says he will not participate in power sharing negotiations with President Robert Mugabe , who was widely accused of using violence and intimidation to win Sunday 's run-off election .

#Text=The opposition leader , Mugabe 's only rival in the election before dropping out due to fears of violence , cited South African President Thabo Mbeki 's role as mediator in the conflict , as appointed by the Southern African Development Community ( SADC ) .
#Text=Tsvangirai has often criticized Mbeki for failing to publicly condemn Robert Mugabe , and has repeatedly called for him to step down .
#Text=Tsvangirai says that " no meaningful progress can be made toward resolving the Zimbabwe crisis " if the SADC or the African Union does not appoint at least one other mediator . "

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=If this does not happen ,  he says , " then the MDC will not be part of the mediation process . "

_	_	_	_

#Text=He added ,  If dialogue is to be initiated , it is essential that ZANU-PF stops the violence , halts the persecution of MDC leaders and supporters . "

column1: #Text=The MDC says that 9 of its supporters have been killed by the state since the run-off , bringing the death toll up to at least 95 .
#Text=Earlier on Tuesday , leaders at an African Union summit voiced their support for dialogue aimed at the creation of a unity government in Zimbabwe .

#Text=" We encourage President Mugabe and opposition leader Morgan Tsvangirai to honour their commitment to initiate dialogue with a view to promote peace , stability , democracy and reconciliation in Zimbabwe , " the AU said in a statement .
#Text=While the opposition rejected the idea of discussion , the Zimbabwe government called it a " welcome resolution " , as stated by Information Minister Sikhanyiso Ndlovu .
#Text=" Government is ready for dialogue with anyone , " he said , " so long as it is n't dialogue concocted by the West . "
#Text=In his inauguration speech , Mugabe had said he was open to negotiations .

#Text=Tsvangirai believes that if a unified government were to be created , it should be based on the results of the original March 29 election , in which he received more votes but not enough to avoid a run-off .
#Text=" We remain committed to negotiations or talks , call them what you will , but they should be based on the fact that we won the last credible election on March 29 , " Tsvangirai said .
#Text=" Then we can move towards some transitional arrangement . "
#Text=The European Union agrees with Tsvangirai on this point .

#Text=Taking into account the March 29 vote , EU spokesman John Clancy says , " it 's clear that [ Tsvangirai ] should be a leading member of that government as its potential prime minister or the head of government to ensure that certain reforms can take place . "
#Text=The EU had been placing pressure on the African Union to take strong measures against Mugabe 's government .
